concise_definition: adj. 下沉的, 令人沮丧的; n. 下沉, 沉没

definitions.explanation_en: The action of moving downward through a liquid or gas, typically due to gravity or loss of buoyancy; often used to describe a vessel or object descending beneath a surface.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由于重力或浮力丧失而向下穿过液体或气体的运动，常用于描述船只或物体沉入表面以下的过程。
definitions.example_en: The ship was sinking rapidly after hitting the iceberg.
definitions.example_cn: 船撞上冰山后迅速下沉。

definitions.explanation_en: Describing a feeling of deep sadness, hopelessness, or decline; often used metaphorically to convey emotional or moral deterioration.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容一种深深的悲伤、绝望或衰落感；常用于隐喻，表达情绪或道德上的恶化。
definitions.example_en: She had a sinking feeling that something terrible had happened.
definitions.example_cn: 她有一种不祥的预感，觉得发生了可怕的事情。

definitions.explanation_en: The process or event of something sinking, especially a ship or structure going under water; can also refer to the act of declining in value or status.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某物下沉的过程或事件，尤指船只或结构沉入水中；也可指价值或地位的下降。
definitions.example_en: The sinking of the Titanic remains one of the most famous maritime disasters in history.
definitions.example_cn: 泰坦尼克号的沉没是历史上最著名的海难之一。

comparison.analysis: “Descending”（下降）是一个更中性、更广泛的术语，可用于任何方向向下的运动，如楼梯、飞机或温度。它不隐含物理沉没或液体介质，也不带有情感色彩。而 “sinking” 通常特指在液体中下沉，且常带有负面或失控的意味。
“Dropping”（掉落/下降）强调从高处向低处的快速或突然移动，常用于物体、价格或温度，但不涉及浸入液体或浮力丧失。它更短促、更直接，而 “sinking” 暗示持续、缓慢且可能不可逆的过程。
“Declining”（衰退/下降）主要用于抽象概念，如健康、经济、数量或态度，强调趋势性的减弱。而 “sinking” 在用作形容词时，更富情感张力，常用于表达直觉性的恐惧或绝望，如 “a sinking feeling”，这是 “declining” 所不具备的强烈心理意象。
